attributes.action: To introduce public toilet facilities on London Underground trains and stations.
attributes.additional_details: I have yet to see toilets on a Underground train, and at the few stations where there are toilets, they are often closed, such at Earls Court station. Most stations do not have any toilet facilities either.
attributes.background: I suffer from Ulcerative Colitis, and find it impossible to travel on public transport, particularly the Underground due to a lack of toilet facilities for me to use, and therefore I get worried about using such. If facilities were put in place sufferers would feel more comfortable using such.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This is the responsibility of TFL who are accountable to the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
